name: Ojutai, Soul of Winter
text:
Flying, vigilance
Whenever a Dragon you control attacks, tap target nonland permanent an opponent controls. That permanent doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest

"When I battled Ojutai, I realized my learning had only begun."
—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest

text:
Create a 2/2 blue Djinn Monk creature token with flying.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

text:
Flying
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
Embalm {3}{W}{W} ({3}{W}{W}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of it, except it's a white Zombie Bird Soldier with no mana cost. Embalm only as a sorcery.)

White creature spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

"The worthy shall respect the worthy. In the afterlife, all will stand united."
—Monument inscription

text:
Double strike, indestructible

{3}{W}: Create a 1/1 white Warrior creature token with vigilance.

name: Okina Nightwatch
text: As long as you have more cards in hand than each opponent, Okina Nightwatch gets +3/+3.

editions.flavor: Only the most skilled budoka could protect the Okina Shrine. Only the best of these protectors took the night watch.
Only the most skilled budoka could protect the Okina Shrine. Only the best of these protectors took the night watch.

name: Okina, Temple to the Grandfathers
text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{G}, {T}: Target legendary creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: If a land can be said to have a heart, Okina is the heart of Kamigawa.

name: Okk
text:
Okk can't attack unless a creature with greater power also attacks.
Okk can't block unless a creature with greater power also blocks.

name: Old Fogey
text: Phasing, cumulative upkeep {1}, echo, fading 3, bands with other Dinosaurs, protection from Homarids, snow-covered plainswalk, flanking, rampage 2

editions.flavor: "These kids today with their collector numbers and their newfangled tap symbol. Twenty Black Lotuses and twenty Plague Rats. Now that's real Magic."

"Beware of trees that talk. Their words are threats. And mind the ones that sway and creak. They too threaten us, but in a foreign tongue."
—The Book of Other Folk

name: Old Man of the Sea
text:
You may choose not to untap Old Man of the Sea during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to Old Man of the Sea's power for as long as Old Man of the Sea remains tapped and that creature's power remains less than or equal to Old Man of the Sea's power.

name: Olivia, Mobilized for War
text:
Flying
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may discard a card. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature, it gains haste until end of turn, and it becomes a Vampire in addition to its other types.

name: Olivia's Bloodsworn
text:
Flying
Olivia's Bloodsworn can't block.
{R}: Target Vampire gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "As we muster for war, I have little patience for lethargy or recalcitrance."

name: Olivia's Dragoon
text: Discard a card: Olivia's Dragoon gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Displays of Voldaren bloodlust are not restricted to glamorous banquets and lavish parties.

name: Olivia Voldaren
text:
Flying
{1}{R}: Olivia Voldaren deals 1 damage to another target creature. That creature becomes a Vampire in addition to its other types. Put a +1/+1 counter on Olivia Voldaren.
{3}{B}{B}: Gain control of target Vampire for as long as you control Olivia Voldaren.

name: Oloro, Ageless Ascetic
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain 2 life.
Whenever you gain life, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card and each opponent loses 1 life.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Oloro, Ageless Ascetic is in the command zone, you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: Last to charge, last to fall.

name: Omen
text:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle your library.
Draw a card.

name: Omen Machine
text:
Players can't draw cards.
At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player exiles the top card of his or her library. If it's a land card, the player puts it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, the player casts it without paying its mana cost if able.

name: Omen of Fire
text:
Return all Islands to their owners' hands.
Each player sacrifices a Plains or a white permanent for each white permanent he or she controls.

editions.flavor:
"Let Balduvia burn to warm Kjeldor's hearth!"
—General Varchild

name: Omenspeaker
text: When Omenspeaker enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

editions.flavor: Her prophecies amaze her even as she speaks them.
Her prophecies amaze her even as she speaks them.
Her prophecies amaze her even as she speaks them.

name: Omnath, Locus of Mana
text:
Green mana doesn't empty from your mana pool as steps and phases end.

editions.flavor: It gathers against the coming storm.
It gathers against the coming storm.

text:

Whenever Omnath, Locus of Rage or another Elemental you control dies, Omnath deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

text: {T}: Target creature becomes a Frog with base power and toughness 3/3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"This creature has hyperevolved chameleonic abilities. It no longer mimics its surroundings, instead forcing them to take on its form."
—Simic research notes

name: Omniscience
text: You may cast spells from your hand without paying their mana costs.

editions.flavor:
"The things I once imagined would be my greatest achievements were only the first steps toward a future I can only begin to fathom."
—Jace Beleren

editions.flavor: A cleric's true balm is the confidence he inspires in his compatriots.

text:
Flying
{X}{U/B}: Choose a color. Target opponent exiles the top X cards of his or her library. For each card of the chosen color exiled this way, create a 1/1 blue and black Faerie Rogue creature token with flying.

text:
Flying

Defender, flying
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

Flying

name: Ooze Flux
text: {1}{G}, Remove one or more +1/+1 counters from among creatures you control: Create an X/X green Ooze creature token, where X is the number of +1/+1 counters removed this way.

name: Ooze Garden
text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice a non-Ooze creature: Create an X/X green Ooze creature token, where X is the sacrificed creature's power. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: Jund has little necromancy. Instead, the flesh of its dead gives rise to algal fiends.

text:

text: When you have 10 or less life, if Opal Avenger is an enchantment, Opal Avenger becomes a 3/5 Soldier creature.

editions.flavor: As the sun grew cold in the realm, the statue grew warm.

name: Opal Caryatid
text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Caryatid is an enchantment, Opal Caryatid becomes a 2/2 Soldier creature.

name: Opal Champion
text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Champion is an enchantment, Opal Champion becomes a 3/3 Knight creature with first strike.

name: Opalescence
text: Each other non-Aura enchantment is a creature in addition to its other types and has base power and base toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage this turn, that damage is dealt to Opal-Eye, Konda's Yojimbo instead.
{1}{W}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Opal-Eye this turn.

name: Opal Gargoyle
text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Gargoyle is an enchantment, Opal Gargoyle becomes a 2/2 Gargoyle creature with flying.

name: Opal Guardian
text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Guardian is an enchantment, Opal Guardian becomes a 3/4 Gargoyle creature with flying and protection from red.

editions.flavor: It was a moment in time, cast in stone—a moment whose time had come again.

name: Opaline Bracers
text:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
Equipped creature gets +X/+X, where X is the number of charge counters on Opaline Bracers.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Opaline Sliver
text: All Slivers have "Whenever this permanent becomes the target of a spell an opponent controls, you may draw a card."

editions.flavor:
"When struck, its hide shimmers through sequences of color—a signaling language I am eager to unravel."
—Rukarumel, field journal

name: Opaline Unicorn
text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Purphoros once loved Nylea, the god of the hunt. His passion inspired his most astounding works of art.
Purphoros once loved Nylea, the god of the hunt. His passion inspired his most astounding works of art.

name: Opal Lake Gatekeepers
text: When Opal Lake Gatekeepers enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Gates, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: Sentries guard Ravnica's landmarks and outlying districts, unaware of these places' import to the maze.

name: Opal Palace
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color in your commander's color identity. If you spend this mana to cast your commander, it enters the battlefield with a number of additional +1/+1 counters on it equal to the number of times it's been cast from the command zone this game.

name: Opal Titan
text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Titan is an enchantment, Opal Titan becomes a 4/4 Giant creature with protection from each of that spell's colors.

name: Open into Wonder
text: X target creatures can't be blocked this turn. Until end of turn, those creatures gain "Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, draw a card."

editions.flavor: The one thing the Gatewatch didn't expect to find on a plane ruled by Nicol Bolas was perfection.

name: Open the Armory
text: Search your library for an Aura or Equipment card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: "Once Avacyn returned, I hoped I'd never need these things again. I didn't think I'd be dusting them off to use against angels."

name: Open the Vaults
text: Return all artifact and enchantment cards from all graveyards to the battlefield under their owners' control. (Auras with nothing to enchant remain in graveyards.)

editions.flavor: When the vaults are empty, everyone is rich.
When the vaults are empty, everyone is rich.
When the vaults are empty, everyone is rich.

name: Ophidian
text: Whenever Ophidian attacks and isn't blocked, you may draw a card. If you do, Ophidian assigns no combat damage this turn.

editions.flavor:
"I will ... tell thee more than thou hast wit to ask."
—Christopher Marlowe, Doctor Faustus

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Jace vs. Chandra

name: Ophidian Eye
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

name: Ophiomancer
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if you control no Snakes, create a 1/1 black Snake creature token with deathtouch.

editions.flavor:
"There are dark, ancient arts that fascinate even me."
—Sorin Markov

name: Opportunist
text: {T}: Opportunist deals 1 damage to target creature that was dealt damage this turn.

editions.flavor: The third time the Oracle glanced suspiciously at him, Starke decided she had glanced twice too often.

name: Opportunity
text: Target player draws four cards.

editions.flavor:
"He cocooned himself alone in his workshop for months. When he finally emerged, all broad grins and excited chatter, I knew he'd found his answer."
—Barrin, master wizard

Little things like morals shouldn't hinder one's ambition.
—Pirate creed

"He cocooned himself alone in his workshop for months. When he finally emerged, all broad grins and excited chatter, I knew he'd found his answer."
—Barrin, master wizard
"Opportunity isn't something you wait for. It's something you create."

name: Opposition
text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

editions.flavor:
"Urza says he's sane. Perhaps, but measures of sanity among planeswalkers are hard to come by."
—Barrin
Exhausting a wizard can be exhausting work.

name: Oppression
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player discards a card.

editions.flavor:
"Do not presume to speak for yourself."
—Gix, to Xantcha

"Defeating an enemy is not nearly as satisfying as watching one suffer."
—The Western Paladin

text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block unless its controller pays {3}.
Activated abilities of enchanted creature cost {3} more to activate.

name: Oppressive Will
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your hand.

editions.flavor: When Minamo was abandoned, its younger students found themselves thrust into a war beyond their skill with talents beyond their control.

name: Opt
text:
Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: "We need alternatives, Hanna," yelled Gerrard. "Now"

name: Opulent Palace
text:
Opulent Palace enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B}, {G}, or {U} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: The dense jungle surrenders to a lush and lavish expanse. At its center uncoil the spires of Qarsi Palace.
The dense jungle surrenders to a lush and lavish expanse. At its center uncoil the spires of Qarsi Palace.

name: Oracle
text: {0}: Untap target attacking creature you control and remove it from combat.

editions.flavor: Known simply by her title, Oracle uses her gift of prophecy to aid her people. She believes Gerrard to be the Korvecdal, the one who will unite the people of Rath against Volrath's tyranny. Her only doubt is whether she will be strong enough to guide him to his destiny.

name: Oracle en-Vec
text: {T}: Target opponent chooses any number of creatures he or she controls. During that player's next turn, the chosen creatures attack if able, and other creatures can't attack. At the beginning of that turn's end step, destroy each of the chosen creatures that didn't attack. Activate this ability only during your turn.

Haste
Tribute 2 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place two +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Oracle of Bones enters the battlefield, if tribute wasn't paid, you may cast an instant or sorcery card from your hand without paying its mana cost.

name: Oracle of Dust
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
